title: “A Stone of Stumbling and … a Rock of Offence”
html:
The Messiah is referred to in the scriptures as a “stone” (seeGenesis 49:24; Psalm 118:22) and also as a “rock” (seeDeuteronomy 32:4, 15; 1 Samuel 2:2). The prophet here uses this expression to describe the rejection of the Savior, the stumbling and offence, by the unbelieving of Israel and Judah. The New Testament writers also cited this passage in showing how the Jews for the most part rejected the Savior (seeRomans 9:33; 1 Peter 2:8).
